goal.en: This course will introduce the current challenge in the thermal management of electronic devices, and some commonly used methods to dissipate heat from electronic system (From simple air cooling to heat pipe). Following by advanced heat dissipation methods and the pros and cons in each method.
goal.ch: This course will introduce the current challenge in the thermal management of electronic devices, and some commonly used methods to dissipate heat from electronic system (From simple air cooling to heat pipe). Following by advanced heat dissipation methods and the pros and cons in each method.

content.en:
This is a lecture-based classes including homework and a presentation is required at the end of the semester.
Schedule for each week
1: Course introduction
2/3: Air cooling
4/5/6: Single phase liquid cooling
7/8: Pool boiling
9: Midterm
10/11: Flow Boiling
12: Thin film evaporation
13/14: Condensation
15/16: Heat pipe
17/18: Presentation

textbook.en: References: 1. Springer, S. Kakaç, H. Yüncü, K. Hijikata, Cooling of electronic systems. 2. ASME Press, Lian-Tuu Yeh and Richard C. Chu, Thermal management of microelectronic equipment. 3. Incropera, Bergman and Lavine's Fundamentals of heat and mass transfer, 8th edition.
textbook.ch: References: 1. Springer, S. Kakaç, H. Yüncü, K. Hijikata, Cooling of electronic systems. 2. ASME Press, Lian-Tuu Yeh and Richard C. Chu, Thermal management of microelectronic equipment. 3. Incropera, Bergman and Lavine's Fundamentals of heat and mass transfer, 8th edition.

grading.en: Course will be determined by one exam, one research report, one presentation, and attendance.
grading.ch: Course will be determined by one exam, one research report, one presentation, and attendance.

en.Assessments: Assignments ， Presentation/Oral Exam ， Research Report(printed on paper)

en.competency: Design / Development of Solution and Investigation
